questions.question_text: Which of the following describes entities? (Choose all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. B is partially correct as we do have service level entity filtrations available too.

choices.C: Multiple entities can share the same alias value, but must have different role values.
choices.A: Entities must be IT devices, such as routers and switches, and must be identified by either IP value, host name, or mac address.
choices.B: An abstract (pseudo/logical) entity can be used to split by for a KPI, although no entity rules or filtering can be used to limit data to a specific service.
choices.D: To automatically restrict the KPI to only the entities in a particular service, select “Filter to Entities in Service”.

choices.C: Service Analyzer –> Aggregation Policy –> Deep Dive
choices.B: Service Analyzer –> Notable Event Review –> Deep Dive
choices.A: Correlation Search –> Deep Dive –> Notable Event

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text: Which of the following describes a realistic troubleshooting workflow in ITSI?
Which of the following accurately describes base searches used for KPIs in a service?

choices.D: All the KPIs in a service use the same base search.
choices.B: A base search can only be used by its service and all dependent services.
choices.A: Base searches can be used for multiple services.
choices.C: All the metrics in a base search are used by one service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is corrcet.
A is correct. Base search is meant for using it in multiple places. It is similar to base search for a dashboard where it can be applied to multiple panels.

Selected Answer: A
A makes sense

questions.question_text: Which scenario would benefit most by implementing ITSI?
ITSI Saved Search Scheduling is configured to use realtime_schedule = 0. Which statement is accurate about this configuration?

choices.D: If this value is set to 0, the scheduler might skip some execution periods to make sure that the scheduler is executing the searches running over the most recent time range.
choices.B: If this value is set to 0, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search on the last search execution time.
choices.C: If this value is set to 0, the scheduler may skip scheduled execution periods.
choices.A: If this value is set to 0, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search execution time on the current time.

discussion.content:
Answer is B.
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.1.1/Admin/Savedsearchesconf
* When set to 'false', the scheduler determines the next scheduled search run
 time based on the last run time for the search
Could someone help me confirm if this is correct
